title: 'I have some gas left in the tank': At 37, Djokovic still has big tennis goals
description: Djokovic has had a rough start to 2025, but shown flashes of brilliance too. And he's aiming for that 100th tour win.
author: Simon Cambers

title: Swiatek avoids second stumble vs. teen Eala
description: After a quarterfinal loss to the rising star from the Philippines last month in Miami, Iga Swiatek rallied to a 4-6, 6-4, 6-2 victory over Alexandra Eala in the second round of the Madrid Open.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: What were the Mutua Madrid Open results?
description: The 2025 Mutua Madrid Open continued on Thursday, when Kei Nishikori scored his 450th career win and Joao Fonseca began his European clay swing in winning fashion. View all the Madrid Day 2 results below. title: What is the Madrid tennis schedule?
description: The Mutua Madrid Open continues on Friday, when top seed and two-time champion Alexander Zverev headlines the action. Fresh from winning his first trophy of the season at the ATP 500 in Munich, Zverev takes on Roberto Bautista Agut in the third match scheduled on Manolo Santana Stadium. Andrey Rublev will then begin his title defence against Gael Monfils in the first evening-session clash, with the seventh seed leading the Frenchman 3-1 in their Lexus ATP Head2Head series. Top 10 stars Taylor Fritz, Holger Rune and Daniil Medvedev will also all start their campaigns on Friday. Fritz takes on Christopher O’Connell on Stadium 3, while Medvedev faces Laslo Djere, and Rune battles Flavio Cobolli on Arantxa Sanchez Stadium. #NextGenATP stars Jakub Mensik and Federico Cina are in action on Court 6. Cina takes on 23rd seed Sebastian Korda, and Mensik will follow against qualifier Ethan Quinn. View Friday’s full order of play below. Read more from Madrid: Djokovic: 'The sport will outlive everyone' Fonseca sets showdown with Paul Alcaraz withdraws from Madrid Nishikori earns 450th win ORDER OF PLAY - FRIDAY, 25 APRIL 2025 Manolo Santana Stadium - title: Madrid Open 2025 Day 2 Recap
description: Carlos Alcaraz’s withdrawal due to an adductor injury stole headlines at the 2025 Mutua Madrid Open on Thursday, leaving the bottom half of the draw wide open as Kamil Majchrzak enters as a lucky loser. On court, the round of 128 concluded with João Fonseca crushing Elmer Moller 6-2, 6-3, Cameron Norrie saving a match …
author: Jonathan

title: Madrid Open 2025 Day 1 Recap
description: Main draw action at the 2025 Mutua Madrid Open got underway on Wednesday with the top half of the draw completing their round of 128 matches. Outside of the on-court action, Carlos Alcaraz revealed that he will announce whether he will play in Madrid at his pre-tournament press conference on Thursday, after he sustained a …
author: Jonathan

title: 'One of my favourite wins' - Norrie battles illness to beat Landaluce
description: Britain's Cameron Norrie describes his first-round victory at the Madrid Open as one of his favourite wins in his career after overcoming illness to defeat Martin Landaluce.

title: Swiatek digs deep to escape another Eala shock
description: Iga Swiatek avoids another shock defeat against Filipina teenager Alexandra Eala by fighting back to win their Madrid Open first-round match.
